args:
Akasha's zombie act works, and she and Melsa
claim the sorcerer's grimoire and use its power
to put the zombies to rest—but not until Melsa
invites them to a friendly send-off party with
all of the other humans!
Go! Slay the girl and add her to your ranks!
(A deadly weapon and a fatal weakness...)
I'm sorry, Akasha, but I don't think killing\nwith kindness is an option this time. YAAH!
Bwa ha ha! You missed! What's wrong,\ncan't bring yourself to mercilessly\nslaughter your friend there?
...Huh? Commander Z, what are you...?\nNo! Bad zombie! Let go of me this instant!
I fear your orders will fall on deaf ears;\nthat zombie belongs to me now.

I laid claim to the zombie's mind when
it attacked, then feigned my own death.
I must say, holding one's breath is far
more taxing than it seems.
But you CAN'T take control of it!\nYou don't have a grimoire!
These raiments grant me a host of\nvampiric powers—including the ability\nto glamour one's prey.
So THAT's what that was all about.
You will refrain from touching so much\nas a crumb of the food in this castle.\nAre we perfectly clear?
Yes, Lady Akasha. Whatever you command,\nLady Akasha.
So when you brought that zombie\nup to your room...
It was an experiment to confirm my power\nworked on their kind, yes. I must say,\nI am impressed you saw through my act.
It was the way you dodged my attack.\nThat isn't how a zombie moves.
So everything after that was just an act\nto get me to drop my guard?!
It seems your eyes are cloudier than those\nof the reanimated corpses you command.\nWell, ＂commanded.＂
Hey! That's my grimoire! Give it back!\nGive it baaaaack!
That should put a stop to the zombie army.
Now let us see which of these incantations\nwill lay them to rest once more.
Well, well. How very fascinating.\nThis tome contains a hidden incantation\nwritten in some manner of code.
It's got a what? C'mon, tell me!
Do you wish to hear it? Very well.\n＂Night, dawn, day. Grant wisdom's light\nto the infernal host.＂
UrR...gH... Wh-what...?\nWhat am I doing here?
Ah, lovely. It is a spell which restores\nthe zombies' minds.
We fought a war. We...fell in battle.\nWe ought to be dead by rights.

You WERE dead until I used that grimoire
to grant you life after three centuries.
So make with the gratitude and smite
my enemies already!
Three hundred years... So long...\nPray, who are you?
A high sorcerer of the imperial army who\noutranks ALL of you, so you'd best release\nme and then get to the smiting!
That's better. Now then, those ladies there\nare with the Alberian army.

We're laying siege to their castle as we
speak, but we need that grimoire there
to do it—so stop all this goldbricking
and take it from them already!
WAIT! Please. There is no reason for you\nto take orders from that man any longer.
The empire you fought for three hundred\nyears ago fell before Alberius.
But the lord sorcerer claims to serve\nthe Empire! Was that false?

His is an entirely distinct entity from
that which you once held allegiance.
He has as much authority to command
you as I do.
Who CARES which empire we serve?\nThose grunts are imperial soldiers,\nwhich means they follow orders!
You're wrong. These people were fighting\nfor the sake of their captive families.
When the empire was defeated, those\npeople were freed and became citizens of\nthe new kingdom Alberius founded here.
The descendants of that kingdom are\ngathered at the Halidom now. It's possible\nthat some of them could even be...

Please, the chances of that are simply
astronomical. And besides, you lot are
hideous zombies now—your relatives
would run screaming if they saw you.
So even if your heirs were there, do you\nthink they'd accept you as you are now?\nNo! So obey your nature and ATTACK!
Request permission to speak freely,\nMy Lord Sorcerer.
If the war we fought is three centuries\nended, our army has no cause to fight on.
I fear my men have done you harm,\nmadam vampire, and humbly ask you\nuse that grimoire to grant us eternal rest.
A gentleman of character, is it?\nWell, this is stirring.
We died long ago, and have no claim\nto cling to life anew in this world.
Rather than cause more terror in our own\ndescendants, monsters of our ilk can best\nserve this world by abandoning it.
Then I shall recite the incantation.
No. It isn't right to end things like this.
The prince and the others return from battle\nto find an unusual scene at the Halidom...
Um...can someone please explain\nwhat exactly I'm looking at here?
The snacks of this age are AMAZING!\nThe best we got back in the war were\nflaky biscuit rations...
Whaaat?! You're my grandpa's grandpa,\nMr. Zombie?

As far as I can piece it together, aye,
though I never laid eyes upon my own
grandchild. To think I'd have the chance
to see a sight such as this!
Oh, we invited the zombies to the\nHalloween party!
Melsa's unbelievable, you guys.\nShe rounded up an army of the undead\nand brought them here to apologize.
Then she got it in her head to make this an\napology party so everybody could put the\nwhole mess behind them, and here we are.
Guess that explains why the living and\ndead are all pallin' around.
Which is actually freakin' NUTS now that\nI'm sayin' it! Who even let 'em IN?!
It's all right, Ranzal! They only attacked us\nbecause they were being controlled by\nsome creep-o with a grimoire.
Yet they remain imperial soldiers—\nimperial ZOMBIE soldiers, in fact.
I told everyone the reasons why the poor\nzombies fought the war way back when,\nand they all—

Yeah, we couldn't help but think of the
current situation. Only reason we get to
live in peace is because you lot are
out fighting.
If not for you, we could've easily been out\nthere fighting for an empire that'd taken\nour families hostage.
Ain't right to live the high life while\ngiving these guys the cold shoulder.
Well, if you're all good with this...
Hmm. It appears a kind-hearted king\nmakes for kind-hearted citizenry.
What's the status on the grimoire, Akasha?
I finished sealing it just now. The Legion\nImmortalis's power will fade, and come\nmorning it will vanish entirely.
The zombies will return to their slumber,\njust as they requested.
Then let's keep this party going till dawn\nso they have something to remember in\nthe afterlife!
This is...quite the development.\nWhat say you, {player_name}?
Far be it from me to get in the way\nof a proper celebration.
Yeah! Let's stop worrying about the little\nstuff like who's alive and who's dead and\njust cut loose already!

And so it came to pass that humans and zombies
joined together for a celebration most memorable.
The party raged on until morning's light came to
whisk the zombies away...
You'll pay for this! This isn't the only\nancient battlefield teeming with corpses!
I'll find some other way to bring them\nback and exact my zombie revenge!
Huh. So I guess that means we just had\nthe night we had thanks to YOU.
Trick or treat, mister. Give us some candy\nand we might just let you go.
Candy?! Why the devil would I have candy,\nlet alone any I'd give to YOU idiots?!
W-wait, what are you doing? S-stay back!\nStay away from me!
